Sofia Fasullo

Urban Data Analyst | Real Estate Development Enthusiast | Philadelphia, PA

Resume

About Me

I am a data-driven urban planner and affordable housing specialist with a strong foundation in real estate development, financial modeling (including LIHTC), and spatial analysis. I hold dual master’s degrees from the University of Pennsylvania: City Planning and Urban Spatial Analytics.

My expertise spans pro forma modeling, housing policy, GIS, and predictive analytics — skills I’ve used in projects from evaluating housing market trends to modeling financial feasibility for affordable developments. Whether working with developers, planning agencies, or housing nonprofits, I bring a rigorous, equity-focused approach to using data for real-world impact.

I’m especially passionate about expanding access to affordable, stable housing and am seeking roles where I can bridge data science with mission-driven real estate development. I’m also open to broader opportunities in urban analytics, planning, or data visualization — particularly in the Philadelphia region.

Experience

Huntington Learning Center

Mathematics Teacher | March 2025 - present

Springfield, PA (On-site).

  • Instructing students on subjects ranging from introductory mathematics to calculus by tailoring subject material according to their needs, sourcing from center-provided, student-provided and self-generated materials.
  • Supporting students by explaining abstract concepts using multiple real-life examples of applied mathematics (ie finance, physics, etc.) and stepping in only when needed to promote student independence and confidence in their abilities to tackle new problems.
teaching communication mathematics K-12

Clean & Green Philly

Tech Co-Lead | January 2025 - May 2025

Philadelphia, PA (Hybrid).

  • Led volunteer team via co-hosted weekly meetings through the Code for Philly organization to develop a statistical model identifying vacant properties in support of Clean and Green Philadelphia’s goal of connecting community groups, developers, and the city with information to redevelop vacant property
  • Monitored organizational communication between volunteers via slack channel and email, ensuring all questions were answered in a timely manner and code submissions were reviewed before merging with website.
Project Management Javascript Python R Logistic Modeling Random Forest Modeling

Kensington Corridor Trust

Intern | June 2024 - July 2024

Philadelphia, PA (Hybrid).

  • Developed actionable insights and funding recommendations for KCT properties by preparing a detailed report and presentation on sustainable building infrastructure.
  • Authored a concise memo on corridor revitalization policies through interviews and case studies to support community education efforts.
  • Implemented custom styling and RSS news and social media feeds on organization website by writing JavaScript, HTML, and CSS code add-ons to site for a user-friendly experience.
Writing Affordable Real Estate Property Law Sustainability HTML CSS

PennPraxis

Research Assistant | February 2023 - December 2023

Philadelphia, PA (Virtual).

  • Analyzed demographic and market trends affecting independent music venues in Nashville, utilizing R and municipal datasets to help identify areas in need of support.
  • Created impactful maps and graphics using R, ArcGIS, and Adobe Illustrator to communicate findings, driving meaningful discussions at community engagement events.
R Data Cleaning Municipal Data ArcGIS Pro Adobe Suite

The Reinvestment Fund

Policy Solutions Intern | May 2023 - August 2023

Philadelphia, PA (Hybrid).

  • Conducted advanced statistical and spatial analyses using SQL, python, and ArcGIS Pro to evaluate housing markets and assess municipal programs, influencing investment strategies.
  • Identified high-priority neighborhood housing markets requiring investment by integrating diverse housing datasets, applying k-means clustering models, and in-person site assessments.
Data Visualization Python SQL ArcGIS Pro Census Data Housing Market Research
